content: ज्योतिस् {%<ab>n.</ab>%} [द्युत्-इसुन् आदेर्दस्य जः, ज्युत्-इसुन् वा] {@--1@} Light, lustre, brightness, flash; ज्योतिरेकं जगाम <ls>Ś. 5. 30</ls>; <ls>R. 2. 75</ls>; <ls>Me. 5.</ls> {@--2@} Light of Brahman, light regarded as the Supreme spirit; <ls>Bg. 5. 24</ls>, <ls n="Bg.">13. 17</ls>; <ls>U. 4. 18</ls>. {@--3@} Lightning. {@--4@} A heavenly body. {@--5@} A heavenly body, a luminary (planet, star &c.); ज्योतिर्भिरुद्याद्भिरिव त्रियामा <ls>Ku. 7. 21</ls>; <ls>Bg. 10. 21</ls>; <ls>H. 1. 21</ls>; <ls>Ku. 2. 19</ls>; <ls>Ś. 7. 6.</ls> {@--6@} Brightness of the sky, day-light (<ab>opp.</ab> तमस्). {@--7@} The sun and moon (dual). {@--8@} Light as the divine principle of life, intelligence. {@--9@} The science of the course of heavenly bodies; astronomy. see ज्योतिष. {@--10@} The faculty of seeing. {@--11@} The celestial world. {%--<ab>m.</ab>%} {@--1@} The sun. {@--2@} Fire. {@--3@} An epithet of Viṣṇu.
